column4: Hello, I am having a sound problem. I have followed a lot of Ubuntu documentation and it is still giving me grief. I can see the card with ALSA Mixer but Pulse is just not having it.
what is the output of: wget -O alsa-info.sh http://www.alsa-project.org/alsa-info.sh && chmod +x ./alsa-info.sh && ./alsa-info.sh
https://gist.github.com/3915654
run the command through and upload to the server, a URL will be generated
Oh, whoops. Here: http://www.alsa-project.org/db/?f=29f3171339ae2779be52b34753ddf1ed4f75691a
if you run the sound app, is the correct device set for sound output?
There is no output device listed. This started when I got a new motherboard.
try:  killall pulseaudio; rm -r ~/.pulse*   wait 10 seconds and reboot
is there an option in BIOS to disable HDMI audio?
Alright, I will see you after reboot. Thanks for the help.
yuou also have an old model=clevo  in your alsa-base.conf which may not work with the new hardware
I should probably mention that I purged PulseAudio because it was causing lockups so it is currently not installed.
Any thoughts on what to try next?
yuou also have an old model=clevo  in your alsa-base.conf which may not work with the new hardware
Should I remove that?
yes as you changed hardware, didn't you?
Yeah. Should I just delete the whole file and regenerate it?
no, just that line, then reboot
So still no sound.
are you using HDMI audio?
No, I am using standard analog audio
